intro: Rosa arvensis f. aberrans, commonly known as the wild rose variant, is a botanical variant of the common dog玫瑰, Rosa arvensis. It is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, featuring larger, more showy flowers compared to the typical form. This form often exhibits a unique coloration, with petals that may display a range of hues from pale pink to deep crimson. The plant thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions. Its botanical interest lies in its morphological variation and ecological significance within its native range.
